description: This Trap is sent when an alarm condition occurs in the power system.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD SP2-MIB::alarmPowerSystemTrap SP2-MIB::alarmSubsysSourceDescr s EXAMPLE SP2-MIB::alarmSubsysStatusOid o 1.3.6.1.4.1.12148.10.3.5.2 SP2-MIB::alarmSubsysStatusValue i 0 SP2-MIB::alarmSubsysStatusOnOff i 0 SP2-MIB::alarmMeasuredVarOid o 1.3.6.1.4.1.12148.10.3.5.1 SP2-MIB::alarmMeasuredVarValue i 9999 SP2-MIB::alarmTrapCounterVarValue i 9999 SP2-MIB::alarmTrapTime s EXAMPLEEXAM

description: A description of the source generating the trap for the Alarm Condition.
Used in alarmSubSystemTrap to describe the alarm source.
Example: 'batteryVoltageDescription'
variables.name: SP2-MIB::alarmSubsysSourceDescr

description: The OID (name) of the object indicating the alarm-status for which the alarm is
generated. The Status must be an INTEGER type.
Example: SP2-MIB::batteryVoltage.batteryVoltageStatus
This object maybe polled by the SNMP management application
to monitor the current Status object.
variables.name: SP2-MIB::alarmSubsysStatusOid

description: The value of the Status object of the subsystem for which the
alarm-status is generated. The OID (name) of this object is
indicated by alarmSubsysStatusOid above.
Example: the value of SP2-MIB::batteryVoltage.batteryVoltageStatus
one of: error (0), normal (1), minorAlarm (2), etc.
variables.name: SP2-MIB::alarmSubsysStatusValue

description: This indicates if the abnormal condition is on or goes off.
variables.name: SP2-MIB::alarmSubsysStatusOnOff

description: The OID (name) of the measured-object indicating some
measurement (e.g voltage) for which the alarm is generated.
Example: SP2-MIB::batteryVoltage.batteryVoltageValue
This object maybe polled by the SNMP management application
to monitor the current measurement.
variables.name: SP2-MIB::alarmMeasuredVarOid

description: The value of the measured-object for which the alarm-status
is generated, for example 13 volt. The actual value is in
units defined by the actual variable (e.g volts). The units
must use INTEGER type.
The OID (name) of this object is indicated by
alarmMeasuredVarOid above.
Example: Value of SP2-MIB::batteryVoltage.batteryVoltageValue
'The measured battery voltage'
variables.name: SP2-MIB::alarmMeasuredVarValue

description: Time stemp of trap
variables.name: SP2-MIB::alarmTrapTime

description: This Trap is sent when an alarm condition occurs in the battery subsystem.

variables.name: SP2-MIB::alarmTrapTime

description: This indicates if the abnormal condition is on or goes off.
variables.name: SP2-MIB::alarmSubsysStatusOnOff

description: The OID (name) of the measured-object indicating some
measurement (e.g voltage) for which the alarm is generated.
Example: SP2-MIB::batteryVoltage.batteryVoltageValue
This object maybe polled by the SNMP management application
to monitor the current measurement.
variables.name: SP2-MIB::alarmMeasuredVarOid

description: The value of the measured-object for which the alarm-status
is generated, for example 13 volt. The actual value is in
units defined by the actual variable (e.g volts). The units
must use INTEGER type.
The OID (name) of this object is indicated by
alarmMeasuredVarOid above.
Example: Value of SP2-MIB::batteryVoltage.batteryVoltageValue
'The measured battery voltage'
variables.name: SP2-MIB::alarmMeasuredVarValue

description: Time stemp of trap
variables.name: SP2-MIB::alarmTrapTime

description: This Trap is sent when an alarm condition occurs in the WindCharger subsystem.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD SP2-MIB::alarmWindChargerTrap SP2-MIB::alarmSubsysSourceDescr s EXAMPLE SP2-MIB::alarmSubsysStatusOid o 1.3.6.1.4.1.12148.10.3.5.2 SP2-MIB::alarmSubsysStatusValue i 0 SP2-MIB::alarmSubsysStatusOnOff i 0 SP2-MIB::alarmMeasuredVarOid o 1.3.6.1.4.1.12148.10.3.5.1 SP2-MIB::alarmMeasuredVarValue i 9999 SP2-MIB::alarmTrapCounterVarValue i 9999 SP2-MIB::alarmTrapTime s EXAMPLEEXAM

description: A description of the source generating the trap for the Alarm Condition.
Used in alarmSubSystemTrap to describe the alarm source.
Example: 'batteryVoltageDescription'
variables.name: SP2-MIB::alarmSubsysSourceDescr

description: The OID (name) of the object indicating the alarm-status for which the alarm is
generated. The Status must be an INTEGER type.
Example: SP2-MIB::batteryVoltage.batteryVoltageStatus
This object maybe polled by the SNMP management application
to monitor the current Status object.
variables.name: SP2-MIB::alarmSubsysStatusOid

description: The value of the Status object of the subsystem for which the
alarm-status is generated. The OID (name) of this object is
indicated by alarmSubsysStatusOid above.
Example: the value of SP2-MIB::batteryVoltage.batteryVoltageStatus
one of: error (0), normal (1), minorAlarm (2), etc.
variables.name: SP2-MIB::alarmSubsysStatusValue

description: This indicates if the abnormal condition is on or goes off.
variables.name: SP2-MIB::alarmSubsysStatusOnOff

description: The OID (name) of the measured-object indicating some
measurement (e.g voltage) for which the alarm is generated.
Example: SP2-MIB::batteryVoltage.batteryVoltageValue
This object maybe polled by the SNMP management application
to monitor the current measurement.
variables.name: SP2-MIB::alarmMeasuredVarOid

description: The value of the measured-object for which the alarm-status
is generated, for example 13 volt. The actual value is in
units defined by the actual variable (e.g volts). The units
must use INTEGER type.
The OID (name) of this object is indicated by
alarmMeasuredVarOid above.
Example: Value of SP2-MIB::batteryVoltage.batteryVoltageValue
'The measured battery voltage'
variables.name: SP2-MIB::alarmMeasuredVarValue

description: Time stemp of trap
variables.name: SP2-MIB::alarmTrapTime

description: When enabled, this trap will be transmitted at regular inervals. This trap is not
intended to be an alarm but more like some information that the system is alive and
the link is up.
A description of the source generating the trap for the Alarm Condition.
Used in alarmSubSystemTrap to describe the alarm source.
Example: 'batteryVoltageDescription'
variables.name: SP2-MIB::alarmSubsysSourceDescr

description: This Trap is sent when an alarm condition occurs in the Inverter subsystem.

event.Summary: Inverter subsystem alarm is $v4 and measured value is $v6

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD SP2-MIB::alarmInverterTrap SP2-MIB::alarmSubsysSourceDescr s EXAMPLE SP2-MIB::alarmSubsysStatusOid o 1.3.6.1.4.1.12148.10.3.5.2 SP2-MIB::alarmSubsysStatusValue i 0 SP2-MIB::alarmSubsysStatusOnOff i 0 SP2-MIB::alarmMeasuredVarOid o 1.3.6.1.4.1.12148.10.3.5.1 SP2-MIB::alarmMeasuredVarValue i 9999 SP2-MIB::alarmTrapCounterVarValue i 9999 SP2-MIB::alarmTrapTime s EXAMPLEEXAM

description: A description of the source generating the trap for the Alarm Condition.
Used in alarmSubSystemTrap to describe the alarm source.

description: This Trap is sent when an alarm condition occurs in the Grid Inverter subsystem.

event.Summary: Grid inverter subsystem alarm is $v4 and measured value is $v6
